content:
Yes, Estonia has a similar digital strategy to Singapore's. Estonia is often referred to as one of the world's most advanced digital societies and has been recognized for its innovative use of technology to deliver public services and improve the delivery of healthcare, education, and other services.

Like Singapore, Estonia has a strong focus on digital government services and has launched a range of online portals, mobile apps, and other digital services to make it easier for citizens to access information and services from the government. Estonia has also invested in the development of digital health services, including telemedicine platforms and online health portals, to improve the delivery of care and to reduce wait times for appointments and treatments.

Another area where Estonia has a strong focus is cybersecurity. The country has developed robust cybersecurity infrastructure and has implemented strict data protection laws to protect the privacy and security of citizens. This has helped to build trust in the use of digital services and has supported the growth of the digital economy.

Overall, Estonia's digital strategy is similar to Singapore's in that it has a strong focus on digital government services, digital health services, and cybersecurity, and it is designed to improve the delivery of services and to support the growth of the digital economy.
